now the hinges chipboard won't work because it's too thick to crease paper
is too fragile so again I figured I would use cereal box first stack
together two panels and measure their total thickness cut a strip of cereal
box to match lightly score it down the middle with one pass of your knife and
almost no pressure and then fold it to pre crease it and then hot glue it on
notice again the corrugation exposed here means that the hot glue has
somewhere to go so it won't squeeze out as you apply the strip plus you get a
crazy strong connection thanks to all that surface area and join the other two
panels together the same way now you stack these two assemblies together with

edges measure the total thickness and cut cereal box to match and hot glue
